website_summaries.verdict: This durable and uniquely designed manual lawn edger is a popular choice that has earned many more satisfied customers than complaints.
pros: Earns praise for the circular handle and V-shaped cutting tip on the blade, 2 features that cut down on time and effort
Blade also has serrated sides that slice through roots and stubborn grass
cons: Rare reports of breakage of the handle with typical use, possibly due to faulty edgers
Some users found the footplate a bit awkward to use

customer_reviews.title: Great Edger.  The best I've used!
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as the Root Slayer shovel. I put in about 80' of edge with this tool in a rooty area. It cut right through all of the small roots. I did have to work for a while on one that was about 2" in diameter, but it snapped after a few kicks. Definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Bullweezer

customer_reviews.title: Premier Edger for Professional and Dedicated Amateur Landscapers
customer_reviews.text: Indispensable tool for its purpose for the professional landscaper or dedicated home gardener. Efficient, effective, quintessentially strong. Cost effective, mechanically effective, eminently more durable replacement for gas or electric "edgers." Easy to handle, manipulate, or transport. Without equal in establishing new landscape edges or "disciplining" existing edge work. "Man hour" reducer for the professional who needs to get the job done right, fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Edging Tool Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My yard is full of the wiry-rooted couch grass. No ordinary tool made a dent, even when I stood on the edger or shovel and jumped up a down! This made gardening discouraging, to say the least. So I gave up, much to my dismay (and I am sure my neighbors). Enter the Root Slayer. Bought it here and have not looked back. This thing is a BEAST! It slices through the densest couch grass matt with a one-footed push. Incredibly well made and sturdy - I'm an edging machine again! Two green thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: MySmartPuppy

customer_reviews.title: Really need to have ten stars for this!!!!!!!!!!!!  Five doesn't come close!
customer_reviews.text: I do some heavy duty landscaping in my home and the homes of relatives. I work in the yard a LOT. This thing is totally awesome. I drag it with me everywhere I go that I know I will be doing any yard work. It has a great foot rest that allows you to get leverage and is awesome for weeks/plants with a long root. It slices through anything but tree roots. I won't ever work without it again and if I had any recommendation, it would be that the handle would be a bit longer or come in different lengths. I got a similar tool that had a regular spade shaped head and I like this MUCH better!!
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as I’d hoped!
customer_reviews.text: I got this shovel to edge garden and it works ok but it’s not as sharp as my other radius shovel. The ground was also dry which didn’t help. Will be giving it another try after it rains which might change my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jn

customer_reviews.title: The next generation of edging tools!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and rugged tool for the garden. May yard has lots of roots and stuff from prior trees and plants, making any digging a very time-consuming endeavor. I started edging my lawn with a shovel and spent more time on my aging hands and knees clearing roots and stones than doing any actual edging! This tools eliminates most of the stopping and kneeling work since it cuts through most roots and digs right through many stones. Pull this out once a year, clean up the edging and save part of your outsourced landscaping budget! $$
customer_reviews.author: Giova

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through like butter and handle genius
customer_reviews.text: This has earned the slayer name. Cuts through like butter and handle genius. Bought the shovel too and equally happy.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Could Have Been Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used it for two weeks. I edged a new garden. It was easy, and cut the thin roots decently easily. However, I hit a bigger root, and the metal warped. I used a different edger, just from Homedepot, and I didn't have a problem. It seemed good, but I guess it's not that strong. Now, I can't use it because it's crooked.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Costing

customer_reviews.title: It could only make the task easier if it had a motor!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace the landscape ties (4x6 pressure treated beams) that I was using to keep the stone bed under my shed where it was supposed to stay. So I used this edger to cut a thin line into the dirt where I pushed some aluminum edging into. It is nice and flat, so it goes straight down, and it does not require much effort, provided that you avoid rocks. This is a sturdy tool, also, and I can't imagine being able to break it when using it for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Steve973

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong but heavy shovel. As far as cutting through roots I wasn't inpressed. Tried to cut through a pencil sized root and it just pushed it under the dirt in the hole I was digging. I will try sharpening the notch in the shovel and see if that helps. Great for digging and prying up trees for transplanting. Handle wont crack like my wooden handled shovel.
customer_reviews.author: Amzman10

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cutting through Roots
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the drain spade. - Great for cutting through roots and digging a trench in root filled soil. Poor for removing soil from the trench. Would be so much more useful, if the handle was full length, allowing it to be used to scoop soil out of a trench without constant bending. - I found it works best to dig the trench with this, and then use a standard long handled trenching shovel to scoop the loose dirt out.

customer_reviews.title: Another great addition to the root slayer collection
customer_reviews.text: We garden a lot, and the root slayers have been a game-changer in terms of reducing back-pain and strain overall. We have the trowel, perennial bed (probably the best fo the bunch in terms of versatility and use), and this one. If you need an edger, this is definitely worth the money. We discarded or given away all of our old ones after buying and using this.
customer_reviews.author: fanofhistory

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Good quality throughout. Main negative (and it's fairly substantial) is that there is no bend in the top of the shovel head for your feet to strike. You need to wear boots or shoes with a thick/stiff sole so it doesn't hurt. I looked at their pictures before buying this but could not tell if the top was bent like the other ones. Well it isn't.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really a fantastic tool. I use it to edge my concrete curbing. I have about 200 ft and it takes about 1 to 2 hours initially and about 1 hour every 2 to 3 weeks. Digs very easily and I have solid clay here in Oklahoma. Tip before initial use if you have never edged wait 2 days after heavy rain and it works like a champ.

The shovel makes it so much easier to dig which I do a lot for my own therapy and without much help from anyone else.....like say my husband. There really are no negatives I can think of .......

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.  Chipping and rusting.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: By Far, this is my favorite digging tool. It makes the most gorgeous edges. I use it to loosen the dirt that needs to be shoveled and for the creation of my mulch boundaries. I also used it to dig a trench from the house to the garage. It cuts through roots, moves stone and rocks out of the way, and leaves a deep clean cut in the dirt. The Root Slayer Edger will not disappoint...
